original: zhag bco lnga'i mdun rol zhag bcu bzhi pa tshun chad du khrus byed na ltung byed du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhag bco lnga'i mdun rol zhag bcu bzhi pa tshun chad du khrus byed na ltung byed du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: From that day, if you bathe before the fifteenth day, you commit a minor offense.

original: de ltar brtsis na bcom ldan 'das kyis zla pa phyed phyed cing khrus gyis shig ces gsungs pa gang yin pa de dang mthun par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar brtsis na bcom ldan 'das kyis zla pa phyed phyed cing khrus gyis shig ces gsungs pa gang yin pa de dang mthun par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If you count in this way, it accords with the statement that you should bathe every half month.

original: gal te gang gi nyin mo khrus byas par gyur pa de'i phyir de'i nyin par gyi nyi ma gang yin pa de nas bgrang bar rtsom na ni de'i tshe nyi ma bcu drug pa la khrus bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gang gi nyin mo khrus byas par gyur pa de'i phyir de'i nyin par gyi nyi ma gang yin pa de nas bgrang bar rtsom na ni de'i tshe nyi ma bcu drug pa la khrus bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you begin counting from the day that you bathed previously, then you would bathe on the sixteenth day.

original: bco lnga pa la khrus bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir gang gi nyin mo dge slong khrus byed pa na khrus zin pa nas brtsams te de nyid kyi nyin mo yang khrus gzhan mi bya ba yin pas nyi ma de nyid ma gtogs
analyzed: bco lnga pa la khrus bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir gang gi nyin mo dge slong khrus byed pa na khrus zin pa nas brtsams te de nyid kyi nyin mo yang khrus gzhan mi bya ba yin pas nyi ma de nyid ma gtogs
translated: Since this contradicts the statement, ‚ÄúOne should bathe on the fifteenth,‚Äù therefore, on the day a monk bathes, he should not bathe again on that day, beginning from the time he finishes bathing.

original: par de phyin chad nyi ma bco lnga ni khrus kyi nyi ma yin pa zhes bya ba @368a * //
analyzed: par de phyin chad nyi ma bco lnga ni khrus kyi nyi ma yin pa zhes bya ba @368a * //
translated: Therefore, except for that day, the next fifteen days are called ‚Äúbathing days.‚Äù

original: ste / de dag tu khrus byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ste / de dag tu khrus byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //

original: khrus ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: khrus ji ltar bya zhe na /

original: de'i phyir / dbang bskur bas sam 'jug pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dbang bskur bas sam 'jug pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúBy consecration or by entering.‚Äù

original: dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: bum pa la sogs pas lus kyi steng nas dbang bskur ba'i tshul du chu blugs pa ste des bkru ba'o //
translated: means to pour water on the body as if one were consecrating a vase.

original: 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBy entering‚Äù

original: chu'i nang du zhugs pa ste des bkru ba'o //
analyzed: chu'i nang du zhugs pa ste des bkru ba'o //

original: chus lus kyi tshad ji tsam du khyab na khrus yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: chus lus kyi tshad ji tsam du khyab na khrus yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúBy how much of the body is one washed by water?‚Äù

original: lte bar son na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lte bar son na'o zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: chus lte bar son na khrus yin no //

original: de yang dbang bskur bas spyi bo nas brtsams te chus lte bar son pa dang / 'jug pas rkang mthil nas brtsams te lte bar son pa rnam pa gnyi ga la kha na ma tho ba rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang dbang bskur bas spyi bo nas brtsams te chus lte bar son pa dang / 'jug pas rkang mthil nas brtsams te lte bar son pa rnam pa gnyi ga la kha na ma tho ba rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, when the water reaches the navel, beginning from the crown of the head, through the consecration, and beginning from the soles of the feet, through the entering, both types of downfalls are completed.

original: dbang bskur bas mgo ma gtogs pa lag pa dang rkang pa'i phyogs 'khur ba dang / de bzhin du 'jug pas kyang rkang mthil las gzhan pa lag ngar dang byin pa la sogs pa'i phyogs 'khur na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dbang bskur bas mgo ma gtogs pa lag pa dang rkang pa'i phyogs 'khur ba dang / de bzhin du 'jug pas kyang rkang mthil las gzhan pa lag ngar dang byin pa la sogs pa'i phyogs 'khur na nyes byas so //
translated: If the consecration is performed, and the water reaches the arms and legs, except for the head, and if the entering is performed, and the water reaches the forearms and calves, and so on, except for the soles of the feet, then a minor offense is committed.

original: gal te lte ba'i ltag yan chad nyi tshe chus 'khur zhing 'og tu ma son pa dang / 'og man chad nyi tshe chus 'khur zhing ltag tu ma son pa yang nyes byas so //

translated: If the water reaches the navel, but not below, or if it reaches below the navel, but not above, then a minor offense is committed.

original: gal te dbang bskur ba dang 'jug pa gnyi gas dus gcig tu khrus rtsom pa ni de gnyis lte ba'i phyogs su gcig tu phrad par gyur pa la ni kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs pa gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dbang bskur ba dang 'jug pa gnyi gas dus gcig tu khrus rtsom pa ni de gnyis lte ba'i phyogs su gcig tu phrad par gyur pa la ni kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs pa gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If both the consecration and the entry are performed at the same time, then the two meeting together in the navel region constitutes one complete offense.

original: 'di ltar yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de'i phyir lte ba'i phyogs kyi gong ngam 'og gi char phyin pa de ni 'dir lte ba zhes smos pa la dngos su gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de'i phyir lte ba'i phyogs kyi gong ngam 'og gi char phyin pa de ni 'dir lte ba zhes smos pa la dngos su gnas pa yin no //
translated: Since it is the nature of a complete offense, therefore, it is said here that the upper or lower part of the navel region is the navel itself.

original: de lta bas na lte bar ma phyin du zin kyang phyogs bsdoms te chog par gyur na ltung byed du 'gyur la gal te ma chog na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: de lta bas na lte bar ma phyin du zin kyang phyogs bsdoms te chog par gyur na ltung byed du 'gyur la gal te ma chog na ni nyes byas so //
translated: Thus, even if it does not reach the navel, if the area is covered, it is a downfall. But if it is not covered, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mdun rol du ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdun rol du ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /

original: chu la reg pa'i mdun rol du sbyor bar byed pa ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chu la reg pa'i mdun rol du sbyor bar byed pa ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas yin par rig par bya'o //

original: chu ma yin pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu ma yin pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'bru mar dang mar dang phrum khu dang 'o ma la sogs pa dag gis khrus byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one bathes with sesame oil, butter, oil-cakes, milk, etc., one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis chu ma lags pa de las gzhan pa'i rdzas de dag gis khrus bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis chu ma lags pa de las gzhan pa'i rdzas de dag gis khrus bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here the scripture is: ‚ÄúVenerable, if a monk bathes with substances other than water, what is the offense?‚Äù

original: @368b nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: @368b nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //

original: thams cad la dus dag yod kyang byin gyis ma brlabs na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad la dus dag yod kyang byin gyis ma brlabs na'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad la dus dag yod du zin kyang byin gyis ma brlabs shing mngon sum du ma byas na nyes byas so //

analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis dus byin gyis ma brlabs pa de la yang ltung bar 'gyur ba mchis sam /
translated: Here the scripture is: ‚ÄúVenerable, if a monk does not make a declaration, is there an offense?‚Äù

analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de sbyor ba btang nas byin gyis mi rlob na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúUpƒÅli, if one does not make a declaration after giving up the preparation, there is.‚Äù

analyzed: sbyor ba gang gis khrus bya ba de btang nas yul yod pa yang mngon sum du ma byas shing byin gyis ma brlabs na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: zhag bco lnga la khrus kyi nyin mo la khrus bya ba gang yin pa de ni grags pa yin pas der khrus byed pa la ni dus byin gyis brlab par bya mi dgos so //

translated: Since it is well known that one should bathe on the day of bathing every fifteen days, one who bathes then does not need to bless the time.

original: don gzhan la gzhol bas chu nyams su myong ba ni khrus ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don gzhan la gzhol bas chu nyams su myong ba ni khrus ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: khrus la gzhol ba nyid kyis chu nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni khrus yin gyi /

analyzed: dgos pa gzhan gyi bsam pas chu nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni khrus ma yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir ma bsams par rgal ba dang brgyal ba la gdab pa dag la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: aa smra pa ra na ta zhes bya pa'i yul dag na ni khrus la nges pa ni med par shes par bya'o //

analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni aa smra pa ran ta'i yul dag tu khrus bya bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir de ni blo gros de nye bar bzhag ste dus ma yin par yang khrus bya'o //
